InitialFeedbackHistory:
01/07/2022
2. Data: You don't have to list your publications and presentations. 
4. Metadata: A collection of metadata standard that may be useful for your work are the MIBBI: https://fairsharing.org/3518, for example MIFlowCyt, MINSEQE and MIQE. For microscopy you can consider using OME (https://fairsharing.org/FAIRsharing.cq8tg2), also have a look at the arrive guidelines for reporting of animal research (https://arriveguidelines.org/) journals often ask to follow these. Another place to find metadata guidelines are repositories, would EBI be suitable for your work (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/submission/)? Reading the submission guidelines of candidate repositories may help you to decide which metadata to collect along with your experiments.
label: good with suggestions
